text: Sampel. Mnostwo beczki, kokosa, bounty i wanilii. Slodkie, gladkie. Miazga kokosowa.

12.7oz bottle. Hazy plum color with a tan head. Chocolate raisin booze cinnamon spice aroma. Cinnamon chile pepper raisin flavor. Heavy body. Warms you up.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a one finger khaki head that fades quickly leaving no lace. Black color, no highlights. Medium carbonation and medium bodied. Cinnamon nose and flavor is cinnamon and bourbon, any chiles are buried, high ABV, 13.7%, is hidden. Beyond expensive at $18.95 for a 375ml caged & corked bottle from Colonial Spirits Acton, Ma.
suszki- sliwki rodzynki, swietna wanilia beczkowa ciastka, tofi, syrop klonowy, super balans miedzy slodycza a goryczka, delikatnie zaznaczona papryczka chili. swietne

375 bottle, served in a tulip glass. Pours a watery slightly reddish brown with very thin white head that disappears quickly. Aroma is big sweet cinnamon, brown sugar, raisins, and sweet boozy bourbon. Taste is thin rich roasty brown ale, big raisin and plum flavor, brown sugar, leather, dry oak, creamy vanilla, sticky bourbon notes. Light sweetness, I expected quite a bit more given the abv here. Just a faint hint of heat on the back, the chiles dont really show much. While this is a quad, not a stout, the thin mouthfeel does seem a bit off for the size and depth here. Still, tons of flavor and richness here. I would guess this was quite a bit smaller than 14% if I didnt know otherwise.

Shared 12.7 oz. bottle. Aged for approximately one year. Pours dark brown with an initially fizzy beige head. Aroma of dark fruit, oak, bourbon, cinnamon, caramel. Taste is bourbon, oak, caramel, dark fruits, raisins, vanilla, cinnamon, brown sugar, faint chili pepper. Finish is sweet and boozy. Amazing - need to find more of this.

Aroma: definitely getting the cinnamon raisin oatmeal cookie; with addition of bourbon...yum; Appearance: opaque black brew with thin white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: amazingly complex. Vanilla, bourbon, cinnamon, spice, raisin. Delicious. Palate: heavy body with long, sweet and boozy finish. Overall: excellent. Would get again if we can find it.

Piana średnia, sycząca, szybko opada do firanki. Barwa brązowa, opalizująca. W aromacie piękna wanilia z beczki, do tego trochę kokosa, rodzynek, fig, melasy i bourbona. Klasa! Smak dość słodki, tu intensywnej wanilii wturują intensywne nuty quada - kandyzowane i suszone owoce (gruszki, rodzynki, daktyle), karmel, toffi, ciemny miód, w posmaku pojawia się przyjemny cynamon i lekkie pieczenie od papryczek. Goryczka średnia do niskiej, pikantno ziołowa. Wysycenie średnie, drobne, lepkie, lekko oleiste w odczuciu. Pięknie schowany alkohol, objawiający się delikatnym, likierowym rozgrzewaniem, bardziej kojarzącym się z chili niż destylatem.

Klasa światowa - intensywne, długie posmaki, niesamowity balans, fajna tekstura, a co najważniejsze nie drażniące chili (to się rzadko zdarza!). Bomba!
Brilliant brew. I love the balance and complexity in this beer. Raisins, cinnamon, bourbon, oak, pepper. And so much more. So subtle. Wow!

Bottle from Johns. Very expensive. Pours a dark brown reddish color with a small beige head. A lovely big nose of figs, berries, bourbon, oak. Great nose. The flavor is big sweet berries, bourbon, cherry, woody, vanilla, quite sweet. This is amazing. Hardly recognizable as a quad, big porter elements. Very good beer. Lots of spicy raisins. Complex.

Bottle from Belmont Station.

A: Dark mahogany, mocha head, lacing. 

N: Chili, cinnamon, plenty of raisin and fig, oak, bourbon, caramel, some peppercorn. I definitely get the oatmeal raisin cookie effect. Clove. Ginger and rye breads. Touch of black cherry, leather, and tannins. Cabernet grape.

T: Lightly spicy ( the chili underpins this really well ) plenty sweet with a moderate bitterness.

M: Medium-heavy sticky body, no alcohol, tickling carbonation.

O: I thought this was going to be a worthy buy -- though I had no idea if the chilies were going to work -- and I have to say it impressed me past expectations. This is really nice. Very complex and sublimely balanced. Bravo.

Kolor brązowy , przejrzyste, piana w postaci obrączki oblepiającej szkło. W aromacie bardzo bourbonowo, karmel, suszone owoce, nuty drewna, migdały, szlachetny alkohol. W smaku również bourbon, karmel, suszone owoce, lekki posmak migdałów. Słodycz jest kontrowana goryczką, pochodzącą od wyraźnie wyczuwalnego szlachetnego alkoholu, a w finiszu czuć subtelną i przyjemną ostrość chilli. Starałem się wychwycić cynamon, ale ani w zapachu, ani w smaku nie stwierdziłem jego obecności. Tak czy inaczej jest to naprawdę świetne piwo.
Aroma: Dried fruit, vanilla, spice. Appearance: Black body, low head. Taste: Dried fruit, vanilla, some chilli, spices, sweet and tasty. Palate: Sweet finish, high body, low carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2017 Bottle from Mikkeller web shop cons 2017-04-11 Geilo
AR: cinnamon, bourbon vanilla, oaky, chocolate brownies
AP: brown, frothy wee brown head
F: bourbon vanilla, oak chips, chocolate milk bar, spicey cinnamon - guess the heat is from the chili;), wee wine, bourbon warming feeling, 
Old rating 4,0 - new rating 4,2

Sample from new friend at BBB cons 2017-03-11 Göteborg 
AR: bourbon vanilla, ginger bread, rich coffee 
AP: dark brown, wee brown lid
F: bourbon vanilla, ginger bread, rich coffee, chocholate cake - great!

Aromat złożony, niczego nie urywa ale szlachetny, alkoholowy w klimatach tych dojrzałych alkoholi, bardzo dużo bourbonu, słodki, karmelowy kojarzący się z czekoladką karmelową. Dużo bourbonu, jeśli ktoś jest wielbicielem, zostanie zaspokojony na co najmniej tydzień. Bardzo ciemne brązowe z ładną kremową pianą. W smaku w sumie nie wiem, czy bym odgadł, że jest w tym cynamon, chociaż potem faktycznie zaczął objawiać swoją obecność takim posmakiem cynamonu z drożdżówek i wypieków, karmelowe, słodkie, ogrom bourbonu i drewna w smaku. Na początku spore ogrzewanie, najpierw myślałem że jest to alkohol, ale potem że może są to po prostu te papryczki, które podobno wrzucili, bo alkohol w smaku ukryty. Spodziewałem się troszkę innych doznań.

375 mL bottle. Originally reviewed sometime in 2013.

Brown with a few bubbles. Just a thin white collar.
Nose of bourbon, vanilla, a ton of caramel. Smells like its going to be sweet. Cinnamon is strong.

Yeah, its sweet. Tastes of a ton of caramel and cinnamon. Barrel lends a nice bit of bourbon and oak. Spicy bite in the finish.

Low carbonation. Very sweet for a quad, if thats what were calling it.

Its too sweet for a quad, but the flavors otherwise blend quite well.

Color marrón oscuro, casi negro, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (poca retención). Carbonatación mínima. Textura oleosa. Aroma a alcohol, madera, canela, pasas, azúcar, frutas y, por encima de todo, cayena/chile (muy presente y apetecible). En boca, dulce, con mucha presencia de las pasas y la canela, un ligero toque picante cuando uno va a tragarla, y mucho alcohol que calienta la garganta (sobre todo en los primeros tragos, luego va disipándose un poco porque a todo se acostumbra uno). Compleja, disfrutable y, pese a tener el alcohol bastante presente, nunca hubiera dicho que tiene casi 14%. Me hubiera gustado algo más de regusto y postgusto. Apenas queda algo en boca entre trago y trago una vez se han disipado el ligero picante y el alcohol.
Pours a dark body with a thin beige head. Aroma of dried fruit. Rich malty taste with a complex setup of malty tones like fruit, sugars, syrup and raisins.

Shared bottle at RBHD, Tau. Pours almost clear dark brown with no head at all. Aroma is deep malty, molasse, cinnamon and chilli. Smooth creamy mouthfeel. Taste is deep malty, fruits, figs, weak integrated chilli burn at they finish.
Shared bottle at RB/HD at Sigmund´s 24.02.17. Dark copper. Pale brown head. Fine aroma and taste of molasses and coconut. Still very drinkable!

Shared 375 ml bottle at local tasting. Nearly black colour, beige head. Strong malty aroma with loads of chocolate, molasses, cinnamon and vanilla. Very sweet flavour, loads of vanilla, cinnamon, coconut and molasses. Only a hint of chilies.

Flaske delt på RBHD-treff hos Sigmund feb-17: mørkebrun med kort skum. Kokos sjokolade ("Bounty"), sviskeplommer, rosiner, kanel, vanilje, havrekjeks. Alt dette både i smak og aroma. Snev av chili afterburn? Lekre saker, og en flott avslutning på nok en super rbhd-kveld.

Gęste, nisko wysycone, brak piany. W zapachu rodzynki, słodycz, trochę bourbonowej wanilii, nuty utlenienia. W smaku suszone owoce i rodzynki, na drugim planie lekko waniliowa beczka i trochę cynamonu. Po wypiciu chilli zostawia na podniebieniu delikatnie ostre odczucie, które dobrze współgra ze słodkim posmakiem. Struktura dość oleista i gładka. Bardzo złożone, ale perfekcyjnie skomponowane.
Super rich aroma, bourbon barrel raisins and chili (nice!). Almost no carbonation. Sweet, bitter and spicy. Alochol is present but for the complexity of tastes it is a nice addition.

Bottle; pours cola brown with a thin tan head; sweet aroma of dark fruits, vanilla, bourbon, molasses, and hints of caramel and cinnamon; taste is sweet with vanilla, dark fruits, molasses, caramel, and hints of bourbon; finish is sweet with some spice notes; very good

UPDATED: APR 25, 2017 Tap@: pours dark brown, slightly haze, with creamy long lasting beige head. Aroma: intense malt notes, which takes on toasted toffee, hint of caramel, coffee, milk chocolate, dried fruit esters, vanillin, cinnamon, hint of bourbon. Flavor is very similar, just more intense malt and bourbon profiles, which are very well balanced. Finish is slightly dry, body full, texture velvetly, carbonation is moderate. Alcohol warmth is gentle, almost 14% is very well hidden.

12.7 corked and caged bottle. Aroma is woody, raisin, bourbon, toffee, vanilla, soy sauce. Pours murky dark brown with a beige soapy head with good retention. Taste is moderately sweet and savory with flavors of the aroma along with licorice, chocolate, alcohol. If this didnt say chilies on the label, I wouldnt think it had them, but since it does, its got me thinking there is a faint spicy heat on the back end. Not the excellence I was hoping for, although it is good.

Une bière qui accompagne sérieusement bien le 7e épisode de la 4e saison de Walking Dead. La robe brune aux reflets rouges de cette bière nest pas son aspect le plus réussi. Sa mousse non plus dailleurs. Cette dernière semble généreuse lors du service mais sessouffle bien rapidement. Quà cela ne tienne. Je plonge mon nez dans mon verre au même moment où The Governer plonge malencontreusement dans une fosse remplie de zombies. Heureusement pour moi, mon sort est bien plus agréable que le sien. Des épices en quantité, de la banane, des graines de lin broyées, du raisin sec, de la pâte à biscuits et de la noix. Cest chargé. Un pain aux bananes et aux raisins secs. The Governer sen sort! Moi aussi! Je goûte. En bouche cest la cannelle qui sort grande vainqueur. Lalcool est présent, mais est-ce une surprise? Dissimuler 13,7% dalcool est une tâche presque aussi impossible que traverser inaperçu un champs contrôlé par les zombies. The Governer réussit mieux que le brasseur de Lost Abbey sur ce point. Jai bien plus limpression dune bière de Noël que dune Quadruple. Jachève mon verre au même moment que se termine lépisode. The Governer et moi-même sommes épuisés...

W aromacie troszeczkę nut waniliowych, sporo rodzynek, suszonych owoców cynamonu, toffi, karmelu, brzoskwini. W smaku pełne, przypomina pyszne ciasto, oleiste, cynamonowe, rodzynkowe, toffi, lekka wanilia, chilli gdzieś może w tle w trakcie picia leciutko się objawia. Świetne piwo.

Bottled. 15cl sample. The aroma has raisin/dried fruits, bourbon/vanilla, caramel, some chocolate. Very dark coloured beer with an off-white/beige head. The taste is light bitter, moderate sweet, has dried fruits, prunes, bourbon, hint of spice (nice and not too strong). Very well balanced beer. Full bodied, nice how the spices blend in. No extreme crazy chili nonsense, but just a little touch to give the beer the little extra.

Medium dark brown color. Sweet malty nose, bourbon, sweet dark fruit but not massively complex. The mouth shows a lot more depth with bourbon, dark fruit, milk chocolate, alcohol well hidden for the abv. Smooth. Good stuff but doesnt go to the next level.

375ml bottle from Saveur Biere. Deep dark beer with sparkling, quickly vanishing head. Small foam molding stays in the glass. Aroma is very strong. It has dark plums, raisins, caramel malts, cinnamon and vanilla and whisky oak feeling. Taste has whisky, raisins, dark fruits, cinnamon. Very delicious overall. The final taste has same spicy pepper. Full body, soft and silky creamy mouthfeel. Low carbonation. Wonderful.

Aroma: Up front is big bourbon notes followed by dark forest fruits, ginger, oak & booze. As it warms up the cinnamon sits right beside the bourbon & I get a very slight hint of pepper.
Taste: Bourbon & cinnamon dominate, cherry, raisins, a big booze kick & the pepper lingers slightly on the finish.
Overall: A lot going on here. At first it seems a bit disjointed, but it was too chilled, once it warms all the flavours appear and it works. A complex & unusual beer that works (once it warms).
Своих денег не стоит. Цвет мутный коричне& дрожжей не пожалел& Вкусом напомни& виски-ко
Отличны& баланс алкогол& и вкуса, много оттенко& от сухофру& до винност& Бочка отлично сочетае& с выбранн& стилем.

Refrigerated 12.7 oz. brown bottle poured into a snifter. Hazy medium brown with small beige head. Aroma is bourbon, medium body, medium/low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is bourbon, dark fruit, and oak.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 z okazji braku okazji tudziez 50tej ocenki quada na RB :> tradycyjnie fajna butla jak to u L.A., nieco mniej tradycyjnie nieco mniej sliczne piwo (piana jak u Bajmu - pojawia sie i znika). Aromat niczego nie urywa intensywnoscia, niemniej bardzo fajnie skomponowany. Sa suszone i kandyzowane owoce a la rodzynki, figi, w ogole jakas tam ich mieszanka (morele np mi wpadly do glowy), sa jakies jakby lekkie opiekano-chlebowe nuty, jest melasa, jest bardzo mila wanilia i jest jej wiecej niz kokosa (wole tak niz odwrotnie), jest nieirytujacy i raczej z tych szlachetnych alkohol. jest tez karmel. i 5 innych rzeczy. Patent polega tez na tym, ze to wszystko tworzy spojna, ulozona calosc, i to jest bardzo fajneW ustach czuc spore wysycenie, wcale nie tak duzo ciala (to co jest, to nie to co sie gryzie, tylko lesli juz, to to co lepi wargi), duzo slodkosci, gladka konsystencje i generalnie analogia do aromatow. posmaki ciut mniej klasowe, bo wygrywa w nich alkohol i pojawia sie jakas przyprawowosc a la pieprz i galka muszkatulowa (kurde, moze i to ten cynamon co ponoc wrzucili?)w caloksztalcie niewatpliwie swiatowa klasa i zasluzone top10 stylu w tych RBankingach, ewidentnie beczka bardzo dobrze zrobila judgement dayowiOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Absolutnie zniewalające, przerażająco pomimo woltażu pijalne piwo. Jest to absolutnie najlepszy belg, najlepszy bourbonowy leżak i najlepsze piwo z dodatkami, jakie piłem. Bardzo eleganckie i wyważone. Coś co bez wątpienia można nazwać dziełem sztuki. Warte każdej wydanej złotówki.

Jedno z najpiękniej pachnących piw ever. Bardzo intensywny, ogrom wanilii, kokosa, toffee i karmelu tworzy wrażenie pysznych czekoladek. Nutka bourbonu I rodzynek, trochę suszonej wiśni, dzień daleko w tle majaczy cynamon. Smak słodki, ale bez przegięcia, w tle lekka goryczka, w typie kakao i paloności. W smaku świetny karmel, bourbon, drewno, rodzynki, kandyzowane wiśnie, melasa, lekka paloność i kakao. Bardzo pełne, gładkie, o niskim wysyceniu. Cudownie się to pije, alkohol świetnie ukryty, choć zaznacza swoją obecność. Bardzo polecam, warte swojej ceny.

375 ml bottle at home. Dark brown color withe beige head. Malty aroma, light roasted, chocolate, caramel, spicy, cloves, cinnamon, light chili, dark dried fruits - raisins, coconut, vanilla, alcohol. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Full silky oily body with soft carbonation.

Pours black with small head. Aroma: very intense aroma of marzipan, raisins, vanilla, cinnamon, wood. Taste: again super intense taste of vanilla, raisins, cinnamon, spices, some wood and dark malt. This stuff is incredible. Top of strong ales I ever had.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2016 Vom Fass bei Stone in Berlin. Schwarzes Bier mit beigem Schaum. Kräftiger Gewürzduft. Wein, Weihnachtsmarkt. Zimt, Muskat,Haselnuss. Kräftiger Gewürzantrunk. Weich und rund. Ganz tolles Bier!

Bottle from Deconinck, Vichte - BE. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: rich bouquet, alcohol, raisin, plums, bourbon and roasted malt. Taste: full body with deep body sensation with roasted and and raisin, plums and alcohol notes. Good attenuation. Sweet, quiet drinkable. Aftertaste: raisin, bourbon, roasted malt and spicy. Superb equilibrium. Amazing.

Bottle. Dark brown colour. Medium beige head. Lots of raisins and bourbon, vanilla, spices, cinnamon, slight sweetness in the aroma. Quite powerful bourbon smell. Bourbon, caramel and vanilla at first. Spucy, herbal in the middle. Nutty, spicy, bourbony finish. Alcochol and cinnamon in the aftertaste. Quite alcocholy in general. Rather heavy bodied, low carbonated brew. Too heavy because of the alcochol.

37,5 cl, tasting glass. Straight from Cali in the luggage, really huge thanks Bob!! Pours a light beige, thin and creamy head; very dark murk brown appearance, looks like a chinotto. Aroma opens with a huge and seductive bourbon nose, "spirit soaked raisins" (italian uvette sotto spirito), very nice vanilla scent, dried fruits, with a sweet-spicy cinnamon and cardamom background. Tastes bourbon infused belgian quad, with a lot of dried and dark fruits component, molasses, toffee, bit of cherry, and some hints of cocoa. Almost medium to high sweetness, medium and light roasted bitterness; this beer is really well balanced and the bittersweet notes fuse into a unique liquorish and smooth phase. The alcohol/bourbon has a huge and integrant part in the aroma and taste, defining a lot of this brews character; its obviously quite present at 13.70% but extremely pleasant and smooth. Low to medium creamy carbonation, full bodied. Ive tried the Judgment Day (the base), and this #8 its both quite different and much more refined/well blended together, even being more complex and stronger. Crazy aroma and wonderful notes going on in the mouth, probably the best Quad Ive ever tasted with Westvleteren 12. TOP CLASS !
A: Dark brown coloured, no head N: Raisin, prunes, bourbon, cardamom, cinnamon T: Cardamom, vanilla, raisins, bourbon, cinnamon O: No carbonation and very heavy on the spices. Nice!

Bottle from jamesy -- cheers! This is a beauty and a beast. Its got a high ABV, spent a long time in bourbon barrels, is spiced with cinnamon and chilies, and is brewed with loads of raisins, so theres a lot going on even before the cap comes off. But the finished beer is really complex. Theres loads of raisin and stone fruit flavor and a bourbon aroma, but its balanced by malty sweetness and a very light spicy heat from the chilies at the end. Great stuff.
(bottle) clear, bright amber brown colour with a small brown head; rich aroma of raisin, vanilla, spice; thick palate; balanced, intense flavour with a long, light bitter finish

Black with off white head - Wood and vanilla aroma with bourbon and dark malts - DArk malt body with dark fruity tones with wood and vanilla flavours along with the bourbon flavours - Dark malt, wood and vanilla goes into a logn and good warming finish
Poured from a 375ml bottle. Spicy, sugary sweet, chocolaty. Oatmeal cookie with spice. Thanks Mike.
Complex aroma and taste. Lots of sweetness with the raisin taste. Very enjoyable beer.

To piwo to prawdziwy sztos dla takiego miłośnika quadów jak ja. Burbonowa beczka jest mocna i świetnie układa się z suszonymi owocami, nie tylko rodzynkami, ale i śliwką, figą i daktylem. Jest wanilia, cynamon i papryczkowe mocne grzanie przełyku. Piwo ogólnie jest gęste, treściwie i mocno rozgrzewające. Jedno z najlepszych piw ever.

At Jerrys LS. Only got the 6oz, which was good, functioned more as a dessert. Wonderfully complex aroma, taste of chocolate, spices, bourbon. Some how I smelled coconut? Excellent stuff, but a full pour, would be maybe just too much, quite rich. Serving: Tap

37,5 cl bottle @ home
Aroma is sweet with Bourbon tones, vanilla, rhum and raisins. Feels sweet and heavy. Flavour has very strong bourbon tones, some oak, rhum, raisins, sweet malt and molasses. Palate is a bit too high on CO2. Warming alcohol in the finish. A slow sipper indeed.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with no head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, dried fruits. In taste the same with cinnamon and bourbon vanilla kick, spicy chili burn mixed perfectly. Full bodied, oily, velvet texture, soft carbonation. Finish is lightly bitter with warming feeling. Fantastic beer, so much various flavours nicely mixed.

Piwo jest ciemne o małej, ciemno-beżowej pianie.
Zapach bardzo intensywny. Mnóstwo ciemnych owoców ale dominujā kruche rodzynki. Do tego sporo suszonych fig i śliwek. Kolejny łomot robi wanilia bourbon i czekolada. To jest taki zapach co autentycznie łaskocze gdzieś w mózgu. Sporo jest też drewna, szlachetnego alkoholu i gdzieś tam kokosik w tyle.
Jest też sporo ciała ale za to mało nasycenia.
W smaku dominuje słodycz. Ale nie zalepia. Mocno grzeje i to dłuuugo. Przy końcu dochodzi przyprawowa ziemistość, dym i prze dojrzałe owoce.
Świetny balans, beczka bourbonu w płynie ale chilli trochę jakby brakuje.
Texas tasting at york, dark brown with a tan head with coffee, caramel, vanilla and spice taste and a coffee caramel aftertaste , so good .

How: Bottle.
Where: Tasting 2016-05-28.
Appearance: Dark brown, almost black, colour with a minimal tan head.
Aroma: Spices, vanilla, bourbon, dried fruit, vinous, caramel, some spices.
Body: Full body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Spices, liquorice, chili, bourbon, alcohol, cinnamon, dried fruti, caramel.

From notes. Enjoyed this at a tasting at Andrews house for my first tasting with the Ann Arbor crew on July 8! 375 mL bottle. The pour is a decently thick darker brown, almost muddy, with a lighter tan head that falls down with no lace. The aroma is full of dark fruits, specifically raisin. There is a huge amount of cinnamon on the inhale that is pretty well balanced with the fruit. A light caramel exists, and there is a little oaky vanilla on the back end. The flavor carries a little more barrel and dark fruit to it. The plum and raisin are nice, and the cinnamon is still large, though tones down a bit. The mouth feel is thicker with a nice carbonation and a lingeringly fruity cinnamon finish. This is an interesting balance. Theres a lot of flavor here, but I think these should be consumed soon-ish.

375ml bottle. Small tan head atop dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, raisin, some caramel, light cinnamon. Taste is sweet, raisin, chocolate, some Bourbon/alcohol, light chile pepper. Boozy.  Sticky full body, light alcohol acidity.

Dark brown pour with small tan head. Aroma of malts, bourbon, fruit, vanilla, oak, cinnamon and coconut. Taste of bourbon, raisins, malts, vanilla, caramel, cinnamon, fruit, chilli peppers and oak. Full bodied, low carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, perfectly balanced. Very complex beer, a real treat!

Aroma: Boozy with bourbon and butterscotch and toffee
Appearance: Dark brown with beige head
Taste: Tootsie roll, brown sugar, burnt caramel. Wonderful smooth bourbon flavor on the finish. 
Overview: Wow. Just wow. Tons of complex malt flavors with the barrel shining through. Raisins are the most dominant note with only enough chilis to add another layer.

On par with Lost Abbeys awesome beers. Aroma was very full. Huge raisin smell with prune, Belgian yeast and other dark fruits. Pour was a nice deep dark brown, near black with a thin light tan film for a head. Taste was huge. A little too sweet and cloying, but with this ABV its expected. This beer is all dark fruits. Dates, figs, plum and raisin are leading the charge. The Belgian yeast dried the beer out a bit, but all in all this was a sweet fruity desert beer. Good carbonation.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle at beertemple. Dark brown pour. Delicious aroma of bourbon vanilla, almond, cinnamon, ripe fruit and chocolate. Flavor is filthy rich, with almond, cinnamon, hazelnut, ripe fruit, smooth bourbon vanilla, mild cacao, spice and a smooth mild chili afterburn that fits perfectly with the other flavor. This is one of the rare examples of extreme flavors in near-perfect balance, thus enforcing eachother. Fantastic brew, nectar of the gods.Im off to build an altar for this one.

Dark pour that looked like muddy swamp water...the kind of look that will make you go "1" or "5" for appearance based on whether it tastes good! Bourbon and chocolate on the nose. Coffee, chocolate, a ton of licorice and a punch of bourbon. This is great. GREAT.

Im a Judgement Day fan, a bourbon barrel fan, and a chili fan, so the premise here excited me. Pours almost stout dark, with a strong nose of vanilla, booze, chocolate oak and raisins. You really have to work for the spices in the nose, but they come out some as it opens. Flavor is sweet and boozy and spicy...all those things plus moderate chili and light cinnamon. Nice sipper. Doesnt resemble a traditional quad anymore, but is quite delicious.

Bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, red wine, cherry - mind blowing aroma. Dark copper color, tiny beige head. Looks pretty decent. Taste is actually even more mind blowing than aroma. Its like liquid chocolate, with cherry, with vanilla, with bourbon, with wood, with port wine. So amazing. A bit to light in the mouth, but still so silky and smooth. For this 13,7 abv - almost unnoticeable. Pure masterpiece.

Tap into a wineglass showing half a finger of clean white foam with a dark caramel brown. 

The nose shows dark caramel malt notes with a strong bourbon (oak and smoke) background. 

The palate is lightly carbonated and lightly bodied. Flavors of dark caramel malts with a light sweetness from the raisins thats reined back by the bourbon. The bourbon adds further alcohol spice to the beer. The out of place hoppy bitterness is subdued by the bourbon oak and smokiness and comes together a little better than the Judgment Day.
Draft at the Lost Abbey 10th Anniversary Party. Lots of dark fruit aromas and flavors. Malty and sweet and delicious.

Tasting session @ Budapest.
Pours deep ruby brown, nose is coconut, raisins, light chili, caramel, wood, taste is similar, light cinnamon, the coconut from the bourbon dominates a little but its pretty tasty. Perfect.

Bottle @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Pours a deep mahogany brown body with a small off-white head. Nose is dark malts, raisins, whisky, wood, alcohol and hints of vanilla, dark fruits, brown sugar and caramel. Taste is caramel, toffee, honey, alcohol, raisins, nuts and hints of butterscotch, figs, dates and dark malty notes. Full, oily body, medium carbonation. Amazingly integrated flavors; so complex, heavy and still utterly moore-ish. Fantastic stuff, probably the best quad Ive had after Westy 12 (which is still king in my book).

Shared bottle. Pours a dark brown body with little to no head. Aroma is complex with loads of dried fruits, vanilla and cinnamon. Taste is sweet with vanilla, bourbon and cinnamon flavors. Dried fruits and a whiff of well hidden alcohol. Fairly flat but still oacking a medium full body.

375ml c&c bottle from Xroads. Poured a murky brown with a nice beige thick foamy head. Aroma of cinnamon, raisin, light bourbon, brown sugar. Flavor of bourbon, touch of peppers, bad raisins, barrel, and sugar. Medium to full body, lots of hear. Solid interesting beer.

I only rate the beers that make me say wow... So mybratongs are biased to the beers I enjoy. This is one of them. So big, such a broad palate, but so do well balanced. Smells like aromatic cookies/cinnamon rolls. Pours with small head, can smell the aroma from a distance. It was a favorite at a recent share. Palate guves you raisins, oak, cinnamon and a nice balance to the sweet with just a touch of black oeooer heat on the finish. If this beer werent so costly, id have tons of it in my cellar. IItsabeauty any stout/quad lover should have a go with at least once. Put it in your "must have" list if youve not already tried it. Highly recommended!

On tap at POUR on Center (1/31/16). Mild nose, sweet with oak, raisin, and plum. Dark cloudy brown with thin head. Medium heavy body with medium carbonation. Sweet raisin, oak, tobacco. Some green-herbal chile notes but not spicy. Warming alcohol and soooo smooooth. Nice sweet finish and after.
Bottle to a tulip. Opaque mahogany brown with mocha head and lacing. Full of flavor, dark dried fruit, vanilla, bourbon, balanced with cinnamon and chili pepper. Delicious !!!

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Deep hazy ruby black colour, with a thin tan head. Aroma has caramel malt, chocolate, roasted malt, and fruity berry. Tastes warming chilli spicy, vanilla, and cherries. Decent thick body.

Bottle shared with Marcus and Robin. Dark brown/mahogny beer with a nice lasting beige head. Raisin and cinnamon, vanilla, bourbon, woody, caramel, vinous, dades, biscuits, chili notes, some prunes. Fruity milk chocolate and cinnamon flavor, grapes, chili, biscuits, warming alcohol, bourbon, vanilla, woody notes, raisins and dades. Oh yes what a wonderful beer. Perfect balance, huge body and loads of flavors. Amazing!

Bottled. Pours dark brown with a small light brown head. Smells caramel malty, dark chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, cherries. Tastes alcohol, vanilla, cherries, caramell malt, coconut, roasted malt and a bit spicy with a similar finish.
Bottled thx rlgk. Dark brown body. Beige bubbly head. Smells of vanilla, marshmallows, whiskey, coffee, chocolate, spices. Tastes nuts, whiskey, vanilla, coffee, spicy. Amazing.

Quad rating #50. Bottle (from Beergium.com, thanks for this awesome free beer!!!). Pours dark ruby-black with brownish beige head. The head stays. Aroma is sour, fruits, cherries, spices, cinnamon, chocolate, hint of chili. Flavor is somewhat sweet and bitter, very noticeable spices, cinnamon, nutmeg, raisins, malt, caramel, touch of bourbon. No sign of alcohol, only some warmth in finish. Finish is malty with some dry bitterness and more spices. Overall: great brew. Bourbon is very well constrained and hardly noticeable (read: it doesnt feel like someone poured bourbon in my beer). The only thing missing is real "wow effect", otherwise this would get even better rating.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 Tasted from bottle. Pours just like a cola. Dark brown with very fizzy khaki head that quickly fades with little lacing. Aroma is dark fruit, caramel, chocolate, bourbon, a little chile, spices. Very complex strong aroma. Taste is also very complex. A little alcohol/chile burn at the end. Moderately sweet with mild bitterness. Flavors of raisins, plums, caramel, maple syrup, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, chiles. Nice complex big beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska bishops Örebro. Brunsvart grumlig vätska. Doft av fat, knäck och kaffe. I smak känns framförallt kokos men ocksä burbounfat, knäck och bitter choklad

bottle from kihoskh, very dark brown, small smooth light brown to brown head. Aroma is complex, spicy, dark dried fruits, cinnamon, roasted malts, very heavy aroma, lots of cinnamon and raisins and heavy dark fruit sweetness. Flavor is sweet dark fruits, roasted malts and a potent chili bite. complex but the spices have almost taken over the flavor, although it seems the base beer does not give up easily, so the result is one hell of a potent punch of beer goodness. sipping beer for sure. also reminds me slightly of uk christmas pudding.

375 mL bottle. Murky dark brown with a light to medium beige head. Aroma is of mostly bourbon with mild raisin bread and spice. Taste is somewhat thin but includes mild raisin bread, cinnamon with a chile spice finish. Not the best from Lost Abbey since beer does not come together very well and lacks depth.

Bottle shared by gorditoabd. Pour is a very murky medium/dark brown with a thin head and lots of carbonation streams. Aromas are classic Lost Abbey: figs and brown sugar and figs and brown sugar. Flavor has a nice black cherry side note that fades in and out a bit. Mouthfeel is a lot thinner than anticipated, but this is a winner!
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Murky brown, small offwhite head. Cocnonut and vanilla aroma. Not usually a fan of coconut, but this is very nice. Fruity chili flavour with more coconut. Where does that sorcery come from??? Well balanced with warming alcohol.
Color is black. Aroma of cocoa, vanilla. Taste is a bit spicy in the beginning turning into a sweet finish. Quite ok beer, but too sweet for me.

Bottle, 13.70%. Distinct vanilla, coconut aroma. Perhaps it is coconut tan oil. Cloudy dark brown colour. Small off-white head. The flavour has a distinct vanilla and coconut note, but I also get some chili. Does not burn too much, but is quite nice. Smells extremely good and also tastes very good.

Bottle. Pours murky dark copper brown with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of vanilla and caramel malt, with notes of fruit and touches of cinnamon. Sweetish flavour of caramel malt and fruit, with notes of cinnamon and vanilla and touches of chilli. Hints of coconut. Spicy and malty aftertaste. Very nice. Non-agressve and tasteful. Good.

Ez a főzde véleményem és eddigi tapasztalataim szerint az egyik legeredetibb és legkiemelkedőbb minőségű söröket gyártó márka, amellyel rendszeresen összehoz a jószerencse, így nyerve egyre nagyobb bizonyosságot az előző állítás hitelessége felől. Egy ital, amely ráadásul quadrupel, sőt mi több, a mazsolával főzött és valóban kimagasló Judgement Day alapjaira épül, emellett azonban bourbon hordóban tökéletesítik, fahéjjal és chilivel teszik izgalmassá, nagyobb meglepetést okozna, ha nem lenne lenyűgöző, mint azzal, ha annak találnánk. Erre, mint már említettem, a Lost Abbey név a garancia, s bár messze állok attól, hogy a főzde fizetett reklámanyagának összeállításában működjek közre e bejegyzéssel, nyilvánvalóan nem is szorulnak rá az ilyesmire. Pezsgő hanggal hömpölyög elő az üvegből, színe mély, sejtelmes és gazdag, akárcsak az illatai, amelyekhez foghatóval csak a legkülönlegesebb darabok rendelkeznek. Amellett, hogy megőrzi belga hangulatát, a diós-aszalványos, súlyos és ódon jegyek komótos aromáját, a bourbon kókuszos és fűszeres karakterét éppoly magától értetődően szívja magába a szerkezet, mintha e komponensek egymástól mindig is elválaszthatatlanok lettek volna. Nem kell több pár milliliternél, hogy ez a harmónia az ízében is visszaigazolást nyerjen a kortyolása során, a lágy és nyugodt, malátától telt, pirított csonthéjasok és füge, datolya jegyei által lerakott alapokat elegáns vonalakkal színezi ki a whiskey vaníliás-kókuszos zamata, a képet pedig egy remekül eltalált mértékben, alig észrevehető módon jelenlévő pikánsság, lágy, nem metszően csípőskés jelleg és egy ehhez remekül passzoló fahéjas fűszeresség kelti életre. Ehhez tényleg nincs mit hozzáfűzni, vérbeli különlegesség, melynek elismeréséhez még csak az elnézőbb énünkre sincs szükség.

Keg at Route CBC, CBC Clapham, 02/10/15. Opaque dark brown / black coloured pour with a lasting loose light tan head. Aroma is sweet oak, vanilla, slightly spicy caramel, some hot alcohol. Flavour is composed of full on cakey malts, vanilla oak, fresh virgin oak, caramel, jamaican spicy cake, rum, dried fruit. Palate is full and sticky, highish carbonation, velvety, cinnamon, . Coconut, and warming alcohol linger.

Interesting nose warming, spicy aroma. Although bit too strong alcohol smell.for me. Some chocolate with some spices, kinda mouth warming with some bitter ending. Very well ballanced. Price / performance although sounds way too much. Great brew though.

Not so big on nose, bet very delicate and inviting sweet spicy cake with some chilli, quite pushy cinnamon, bit clove and licorice,, but very fit in overall picture. At first it reminds me more of stout than quad mostly because of bourbon and choco influence, but after a while 
quad overcomes, making interesting balance. A lot of raisins, huge malty backbone, but would like to taste it even more bold. Mostly sweet all the way with some warming alco and bitterness in finish. Quite long choco and cinnamon aftertaste. Really awesome brew. Only thing that price/performance is too harsh
From bottle shared at home. Pours cloudy brown, thin white head. Taste is oatmeal cinnamon, raisin, bounty chocolate. Long lovely aftertaste. No doubt one of the best beers Ive had.
From a bottle shared at home. Pours a cloudy brown with an ecru head. Bourbon nose. Flavors of cinnamon, ancho chilis, chocolate and vanilla. Hot, boozy and tasty.
Fig, coconut, raison, some yeasty spice, cocoa, dark fruits, some biscuity malt, cinnamon, a little bit of bourbon. Finish is coconut, booze, spice. Quite nice.

Bottle shared with the guys. Deep slightly muddy brown pour with floaties, thin white head. Aroma is really nice, rich fig and raisins, port notes, tons and tons of vanilla, smells like cinnamon rolls actually. Taste is sweet, light cinnamon, tons of vanilla, dried fruits, very well hidden alcohol. Palate is full bodied, light alcohol warmth. Very nice sipper.
Bottle. Dark brown with tan head. Interesting aroma, cinamon, coconut, bisctuit. Taste is strong of coconut and cinamon, some chocolate and biscuit.

Dark murky brown, soft bubbled ringed head. Nose is boozy coconut, red lemonade, light oaty spice. Initial taste is a rich tarry bourbon, proper decssy coconut cloud around this. Carbonation is slight and the mouthfeel is clammy. Finishes soft clumpy coconut, faintest roast and lingers a lean spice.Bottle, Garvies, fae Beergium
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy dark brown with a thin tan head. Aromas of strong coconut, vanilla, cinnamon. Taste is light spice, vanilla biscuit. Coconut wafers. Dry finish.

Bottle at craigs. Pours deep ruby brown, nose is coconut, raisins, light chili, caramel, wood, taste is similar, light cinnamon, the coconut from the bourbon dominates a little but its pretty tasty.

bottle at home dark brown ... jan 2016 ... thin tan lacing ... soft meaty roast .. big cinamon .. dark fruit roasdt malts npse .. dark fruit .. dark roast ... big roast .. big cinamon .. dark chocolate roast .. soft coconut roast ... dry coconut .. lightest chilli

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares #whoknowshowmany. Pours muddy brown with a small offwhite head. Aromas of bourbon, dark fruits, cinnamon, vanilla, chocolate. Taste is bourbon, chocolate, vinous, malt, dark frutis, vanilla, booze.
On tap at FOBAB 2015. Drunken notes written in program note vanilla spicy sweet taste. Good

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #17 Pours brown with a beige head. Aroma of dark sweet fruits, bourbon soaked raisins, cinnamon, prunes, tannin, toffee and with a vinous note as well. The taste has notes of caramel, sweet toffee malts, dark sweet fruits, weak spices, tannin and bourbon which is very dominant in the aftertaste.
Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #17. Brownish/amber pour with a small head. Notes of dark dried fruits, prunes, cinnamon, coconut, vanilla, malty sweet, bourbon, raisins and some light mint.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #17. Pours a dark, murky brown with a fizzy, off white head. Aroma has boozy bourbon, raisins, prunes, cinnamon, caramel, toasted malts, vanilla, coconut, slightly vinous. Taste is sweet, boozy, spicy, coconut, spicy, smooth bourbon-finish. Medium oily texture. Could have more body in my opinion. Average to high carbonation.

Dark brown color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of sweet toasted malt, yeast, dark fruit, some caramel, & rich spice; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, molasses, rich dark fruit (notably plums & figs), raisons, some chocolate, and subtle chillies; Warm spicy finish; Nicely balanced & complex; Ridiculously good quad!

1500th review!!!. Pours black with brown edges with a one finger tan head with good lacing. Aroma dark fruits, bourbon, cinnamon, raisins, woody notes, chili peppers, caramel, sweet malts, vanilla, butterscotch, and some light booze as it warms. Taste is dark fruits, bourbon, cinnamon, woody notes, sweet malts, caramel, vanilla, butterscotch, chili peppers, smoke, licorice, anise, coco, chocolate, and some light booze. Has a medium-full body with a creamy, semi oily mouthfeel, and a mostly sweet, warming, long, lingering finish. Overall, a incredibly complex, tasty quad, that is very unique as isnt nearly as boozy as I though it would be.
Drank at Thijs place in Waalwijk 20-12. Liked this beer very much. Overwhelming taste, nice bourbon-sweetness. Rich beer.

Oct 2015 - Keg at Route CBC event, Clapham. As Lost Abbey Track #8 (Number of the Beast). Very dark brown, red hue, foamy tan head. Aroma is strong cinnamon, coconut, chocolate. Body is medium, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is coconut, cinnamon, soft malts and a dry finish. Works very well. Tasty stuff.

37,5cl bottle from beergium I think :-) Dark brown color. Thin brown head. Body is medium, soft and not that carbonated. Finish is super long and dry. Gets better as it warms up. Taste is medium to high sweet, medium bitter. Aroma is chocolate, raisin, light chili, vanilla, wood, roasted, mushrooms, fruit, super spicy.

December 16, 2015 - bottle from Total Wine. Dark brown pour with some head that faded somewhat quickly. Aroma was strong on the cinnamon, had bourbon, spicy pepper and dark fruit. Taste was consistent with aroma where the cinnamon was strong and the other flavors were mildly blended in the background.

375 ml corked and caged bottle poured a clear reddish brown with a lasting tan head. Aromas of cinnamon, chilies, toffee, cocoa, light Bourbon and a hint of oak. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of cinnamon, cocoa, toffee, chilies, light raisin and light bourbon with a smooth lingering fruity cinnamon finish.

375 mL bottle. Dark brown with an average beige head. Aroma is of cinnamon, raisin bread, fig newtons, prune, light chocolate, and dried cherries. Taste is of chocolate, raisin bread, cinnamon, dried fruits, booze, fig, dates, caramel, and brown sugar.

Bottle. The look is dark, brownish muddy red in color, with tan head. The smell is cinammon, raisan toast, fruit, brown sugar, big, chile, sugar, good. The taste is very similar. Slightly sweet. A little rich. Big and rich.

375ml. Purchased in Eugene, OR a few years back. Drank November 2015. Jet black pour, little head. Lightly spiced up nose with hints of bourbon and dark cocoa beneath. Flavor is raisiny up front, while bringing in the cocoa in the mid-palate, hinting at the cinammon and spice blended with bourbon and a tiny bit of heat in the back. Id imagine this one being HOT fresh after bottling. Glad I waited a few years. Thick, dank.

Bottle. Pours dark brown. Aroma is vanilla, bready malts, dark fruit, cinnamon, oak, bourbon, and caramel. Flavor matches the aroma and is really nice; cinnamon is subtle but I never picked up any chiles. Medium body.

Bottle. (bought at Mikkeller & Friends in August 2015)

Almost black with a small tan head. Aroma of cocoa, cinnamon, some bourbon, mint and dried fruit. Similar taste. Also warming alcohol. Quite sweet and with a medium mouthfeel. A tasty one.

Bottle as "Track #8", 13.7%. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, cinnamon and spices. Flavour is malt, caramel, cinnamon , dark fruit, spices, sweet, more spices, vanilla, wood, oak, warming with notes of alcohol.

Bottle (375 ml) at home. Split 2-ways. Dark brown with a medium beige head, moderate retention, leaving little to no lacing. Aroma is raisins forward. Theres also cinnamon, boozy notes, caramel malt, vanilla notes, mild roasted presence and chocolate. Taste is moderately sweet and also raisins forward. Theres bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, chocolate, caramel and a mild chili pepper presence (a little more than the nose, but still not that much) that gives an interesting warming presence. Medium body, lacking a bit in that department for a nearly 14% abv quad. Moderate carbonation. Mouthfeel is a bit chewy, which is nice, but doesnt compensate for the otherwise disappointing mouthfeel. Spicy and boozy finish. Balance isnt bad considering everything used in that beer and I guess some time did help achieve it, but it defintely lack in the body and mouthfeel department. Average.

@ Stordirren 15-11-03: Present. Tack till Eddan. Mycket stor doft av russin, bourbon, kanel och lite mynta. Smaken är en liten aning tunnare men riktig god med dold alkohol, lite chilli samt russin och nötter. Riktigt gott.

Draft at Khyber Pass. Very dark brown pour with just a whisp of disappearing tan foam. Big malt flavors. Bourbon. Raisins. Chili peppers. Chocolate cordials. Cinnamon. Molasses. Charcoal briquettes. Candied ginger. The spicy burn at the end works well with the high ABV. More depth on the tongue than in the nose. A spicy chocolate cake soaked in Bourbon.

30-OCT-2015, bottle @Ulkløbben meeting, @Sonni.
Dark Brown with lasting, low, tan head. Coco, cinnamon, Bourbon, raisin, nuts, spices. Chili can be detected. Lively carbonation, sweet full body. Too sweet and too perfumed but otherwise a very complex and interesting beer.

Pours a dark brown from a bottle, lots of sediment settling to the bottom of the glass, fizzed like a soda after the pour, little lacing. Boozy, bourbon-y aroma, raisin flavor with some bitter pecan toward the end. Probably should have let this one age a little. Good beer nonetheless.

375 mL bottle, given to me by my girlfriend (now wife) two years ago, and shared at my going away bottle share. Light, hazy brown color, with a small, frothy, brown head. The nose is immense, incredible, and absurdly complex. Notes of toasted coconut, vanilla, milk chocolate, figs, cinnamon, smooth oak and bourbon, and butterscotch. Very sweet and just a touch boozy. Theres a touch of bitterness in the flavor, but only if you look for it. Very heavy body, creamy, thick, silky, and just a little warming. This beer is simply fantastic - gloriously aromatic, with a luxurious mouthfeel, and very sweet flavor, without being cloying. This hits all the high points of a great barrel aged beer, without the pitfalls of booziness. I would buy this again, without hesitation.

Bottle. Dark brown in color with an off-white head. Dark ripe fruityness, some vinous notes, hints of cocoa and mild spicyness in aroma. Feels quite rich and nice. Smooth one too. Raisins and notes of slightly spiced chocolate in taste. Warming notes are evident, even if not overwhelming. Wood, dark fruits and boozy notes in finish.

Draft at chucks cd. Apparently they do 4oz pours of expensive beers, which makes me super excite. Anyway, deep brown, verging on black pour with some head and nice irregular lacing. Aroma is coconut and mulling spices. Molasses and raisins to boot. Smells perfect for this onset of fall weather -- this is the kind of seasonal drinking I can get behind. Taste is sweet, chocolate cinnamon coconut covered raisins (so, you know, basically the nose but with more flair). But unlike raisinets, Im 100% behind this. Full body, soft carbonation, velvety smooth body. Overall: a decadent delight.

375ml bottle from Beergium.com


Dark stuff with a beige head. Plum, wood, salt, liquorice, alcohol, strong, spices. Excellent Saturday evening sipper.

On tap at Craft Covent Garden, black dark brown colour lasting tan head. perfumed jammy blackcurrant. Jammy black fruits. Tastes like cardigans. Warm and jammy. Sunday high tea. Certainly entertaining. Perfumed jam .

Tap, Pors dark brown, almost black, withlight brown small head. Aroma is complex and bold. Cinnamon, cinnamon roll, cake, coffee, oaky vanilla, sweet fruit, toasty malts, light fresh fruity, chestnuts, bourbon. Taste is rich as.. Bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, plum cake, dough, sweet dark fruits, dates, more roasty, burnt caramel, bourbon booze, coffee, cocoa. Just really spicy. And quite dry finish with a nice long spicy chile heat. This is good, really a winter warmer.

Keg at Route CBC. Opaque very dark brown to black, beige to tan brown head. Nose is big toasted coconut, sweet, cloying, vanilla, slight aniseed, something barrel aged like bourbon. Underneath all that its hard to pick out much else. Taste is toasted coconut, bourbon whiskey, sweet cloying, slight aniseed, cinnamon, slight roasted malt, some hop bitterness. American whiskey bomb. Cant taste the beer in here. No balance, too sweet, and the barrel aging has overwhelmed the beer. Not undrinkable but not easy to enjoy.
Keg at route CBC, London. ark brown small beige head. Aroma is sweet coconut and cocoa. Taste is sweet and big coconut. Medium to full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, lovely really.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark coca cola pour with a frothy beige head, aroma has cinnamon and molasses, taste has raisins and coconut, some xmas spices, a hint of chocolate.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 37.5cl bottle served in a snifter. Pours dark brown/deep garnet colour with a tan head which last well. Aroma is boozy fruit cake with a heavy vanilla (bourbon) presence, Taste is raisins, woody (cinnamon), vanilla, chocolate, bourbon all expertly blended together with very little bitterness. No chilli presence for me but maybe coming from Mexican Cake that was a high level of heat. Overall this is like liquid Christmas cake and almost perfect. A little more chilli and maybe more bourbon aging would elevate this to perfect - I am however, splitting hairs here and will choose the occasion for my other bottle carefully.

Aroma is oak, sweet bourbon, some spices. Dark brown pour with thin off white head. Medium body slightly sticky after feel in mouth. Taste is pretty nice. Strong bourbon, some spice, and sweet dark fruits. Definitely a good sipper.

Pours dark brown with thin light head. Smell is loads of cinnamon, raisins and other fruit. Taste is raisins and cinnamon, with slight barrel taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle at home. pours cloudy port wine alike amber. Aroma is quite intriguing, the combination of the oak and the spices give a kind of mix between a Kirsch and Amaretto-like almond spirit. Cinnamon well noticeavble. Medium body, loads of alcohol and warm spices, winter warming glühwein is never far away. Taste of cinnamon & kirsch.

Bottle at a tasting. Some cinnamon in the aroma and flavor. Sweet malt, but ruined by an unnecessary bourbon flavor with dry oak that pretty much ruined what was probably a good beer. Good palate anyway.

A very dark brown beer, a head is medium and beige. Aroma is rich, dried fruits, raisins, prunes, barrel, cactus and sweetnesss. Taste has raisins, dried fruits, also some fresh fruits, cinnamon, sweet and warming alcohol in the end. Surpringly light palate even the alcohol level is so high. Not so good as the basic Judgment Day, the barrel is too dominating.
Bottle: Poured a black color with a tan head. Aroma is cherry with booze, and spice. Taste was super hot with cinnamon, spice, fruit, and heat in the finish.

Bottled. Poured deeper iced tea brown with a splotchy beige head. The aroma picked up cinnamon, raisins, figs, and black pepper upfront, with more cinnamon and smoked chiles following.. warmth was apparent, but it never got in the way. The flavor opened with spicy cinnamon and smoked chiles, with raisins, molasses, and figs following.. the spices held well throughout, leaving nice cinnamon around and some belly warmth from the smoky peppers.. lots going on, but it was very well balanced. Heavier-bodied and very tasty.. loved it!
Hazy brown pour. Slight tan head. Cinnamon nose and cinnamon, brown sugar and raisin taste. Boozy and really nice.
Bottle shared at tasting. Dark brown pour with minimal head. Very strong cinnamon and spice aroma. Taste follows with raisin and typical quad characteristics. Very different but really good.
Bottle shared by Tom - thanks! Rich deep amber pour with minor head. Cinnamon, bourbon, rich and awesome!

Dark brown minimal head. Nose is like a wine cellar, musty barrel, raisin, booze, cinnamon. Taste is interesting. Definitely barrel,must, raisin and dark fruits, a bit of cinnamon, a spicy pepper note on the very finish, also boozy but not insane. It's complex, I just don't love it.

Bottle. Pours a dark opaque brown with fizzy spotty off white head. Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, slight booze, slight spiciness. Taste is magnificent, almost like a hint of vanilla cake to go with the raisins and caramel. Hint of spiciness. Booze. Flavors flow together nicely.

Very fine stuff. Aroma of florals, molasses, raisin, light oak some citrus and leather and a touch of booze. Pours black with good head and lacing. Texture thick and oily. Some syrupy consistency but not overdone. A touch of tang on finish as well. Bottle.

375ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours deep brown with a small off-white head. Aroma is cinnamon, caramel, raisins, plums, chilies, christmas cake, belgian candi sugar and bourbon is hardly present. Flavour is sweet but not overly sweet. Full bodied, smooth texture, soft carbonation. Finish is fluid christmas cake with a hint of bourbon. Well-balanced!

Draft at Ale Arsenal. Black with a small light khaki head. Nice spicy aroma, a little chile and cinnamon. Roasty chocolate flavor with big cinnamon, chile, and anise, dark fruit and bourbon. Fairly full mouthfeel with smooth palate.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA (purchased by my glorious wife). Aroma is rum cake, booze-soaked raisins, oatmeal cookies. Taste is rich, dark fruited, boozy breads. This is a thick, punishing pudding of a dessert beer.

Flaska från Craftbeer/Galatea. Smak och doft av fina och komplexa smaker av bourbon, rom-russin, kanel och lagom mängd chili. Väl dold alkohol, kraftull, lagom sötma, välbalanserad och fantastisk god!

Flaska från Craftbeer/Galatea. Ännu en stor kraftig komplex fatlagrad best till dryck från LA. Stor kropp, rejäla bourbontoner, (rom)russin,lite kane och ett uns chili. Väl dold alkohol. Riktigt maffig och väldigt gott.
Fonefan 201214. Brown colour with no head. Aroma is raisin, plum, alcohol, cocos. Flavour is raisin, plum, alcohol, cocos, spices, oak, bourbon. Full body. Very nice beer.

Nose is oatmeal raisin cookie, vanilla, sticky toffee pudding. Flavor is same plus milk chocolate, moderate barrel presence, some heat from the chilies. All flavors present are balanced really nicely.
Black pour from draft with white head. This puppy is intense and awesome. Sweet cookie batter, cinnamon, butter, cocoa, vanilla and oatmeal flavors. So much flavor, so little time. Fantastic beer
Wonderful on the tongue this is the bottle you should let age after a while. Pours a tan head that dissipates over time.

Bottle. Pours out a muddy brown color with a small off white head. Aroma is of dried fruits, sweet sugary syrup, some alcohol and light earthy pepper; no real tell of spice on the aroma. Taste is complex, dried dark fruits, syrup, cinnamon sugar, oak, booze, light pepper. Overall abv was every well hidden.

Amazing that I didn?t know what was being served and the first thing I said was how much raisin flavor there is. Sweet sugary smell deep ripe almost spoiled fruit scent. Slight heat from chili but not very harsh. Light spices for cinnamon,  but very good all around. Bourbon is done correctly. Not overt the top, just a nice touch.  Bottle

Cork and caged 12,7oz bottle poured into a Corsendonk badged stemmed tulip on 15th May 2015. Ruby hints around the edges of this dark forbidding brew, on top a huge tanned foam blanket. The aroma is rum soaked raisins covered in milk chocolate. The taste has chillies to give a bite to the chocolate raisins and rum from the nose. Rich, smooth yet the chillies add an extra dimension along with the cinnamon sticks which gave another twist to the tail of the brew. Appealed to my sweet tooth and love of hot, spicy food: a very interesting and different beer, glad I bit the bullet and paid the extra dosh for a truly world class beer.

On tap at the source. Pours dark brown with minimal head. Aroma is strawberries and dark fruits. Flavor is super fruity figs strawberries. Incredible. Just crazy good. Amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a fizzy creme colored head. Strong aroma of raisin over medium carbonation. Raisin, coconut with a touch of spice that provides some heat. A bit thin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska på gh, Uppsala. Mörk färg, lite skum som snabbt försvinner. Doften domineras av russin och Bourbon men chilin märks också av. Smak av russin, Bourbon och lite chili och alkohol. Smakar som en lagrad, god, maltig barley wine. Mycket gott!

375ml bottle in a taster. Pours dark brown with a small head. Aroma of bourbon, some dark fruits and raisins, dark malts, some light chiles, cinnamon and other spices, and some light vanilla. Flavor the same with a very nice blend. Smoother texture. A really cool beer.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2015 Draught at Lord Hobo 3/19/15Another headless pour, yet this one is clear, oddly enough. Ruby-amber with no bubbles in suspension.Initially candied cinnamon and light raisins fill the nose with a touch of black pepper. With warming tons of coconut notes emerge to the point of dominance. Still, there is certainly that oatmeal cookie thing going on, as again, like track 10, no alcohol is perceptble.Heavy, heavy barrel tannin, not so much astringent as it is coconuty. Cinnamon certainly apparent with the chili sitting mildly in the background. Just too much raw barrel and too low carbonation mixed with a somewhat thin texture. Alcohol sneaks up on you. Yes, these are meant to be sippers but they still need a richer, more comforting texture. Or do they? Maybe these are just meant to drink like scotch? I dont know, not what im looking for in a beer.
Dark candy raisin, brown slightly hazy, tan foam, creamy, banana, coconut, alcohols, peppers

7 Feb 2015, bottle. brown. nose is chocolate, tart, sweet fruit (raspberries?). thin/med body and mildly fizzy. chocolate, raisins, faint cinnamon, faint tobacco, oatmeal malt. some alcohol. really nice.
Mahogany. Huge raisins, some booziness. Taste is raisins, vanilla, tempered booze, cola. Sticky mouthfeel.
At Matts for payoffs. Pours dark dark brown no head. Aroma is musky almond twangy, hint of raison. Taste is twangy fizzy edge of funk, thin raisins, tanic, sweet.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Pours black to brown with a beige head, aroma of roasted coconut, vanilla, wood and dried fruits, flavor of plums, wood, coconut, bourbon and wine, medium to full bodied. Nice

Bottle 375ml. corked. [ As Lost Abbey Box Set: Track #8 (Number of the Beast) ].Light unclear medium brown color with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, almonds - marzipan, raisin, moderate yeasty, spicy, cinnamon, alcohol. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, spicy, clove, christmas spices, vanilla, bourbon, cinnamon. Body is medium, texture is oily - creamy, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20141220]

375, corked and baled. Pours a jet black with a dense and creamy burnt tan head that fades quickly away. Big sweet nose, tons of raisins, followed by apricots and cinnamon. Creamy, somewhat thin body with some lively carb. Hot attack, a little boozy, showing raisins, cinnamon, apricots, and vanilla. Very sweet. Body is a bit thin, booze shows hot, and flavor leans to the sweet,

Pours a very dark brown with small head. Oatmeal raisin cookies with an earthy peppery kick on the nose. Rich chocolate, vanilla, molasses, raisins, oatmeal, slight chilli all precisely balanced. Bit of alcoholic note on the back but nothing near its 13%. Low carbonation, medium mouthfeel.

Bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a small, frothy off-white head, short retention with spare lacing. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, sweet toffee and caramel malt, dates, figs and prunes with nutmeg and cinnamon. Flavor is sweet malt, nutmeg and cinnamon, brown sugar, vanilla and bourbon, light oak notes and a sweet finish. Full body and light carbonation.

At a tasting, thanks DSG, bubbly light brown head, opaque extremely dark brown color, aroma of coconut, vanila and wood, with a hint of dark fruit, and some light spiciness coming through,flavor of coconut and bourbon with some chillie spiciness, dark bitter chocolate and apricot jam, very sweet but not cloying. The bourbon character is much too strong at start but allows other traits to come through in time, still a bit too one dimensional though quite enjoyable.

(Bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Dec 15 2014) Pours a deep brown with basically no head. Aroma has dark malt, caramel, raisins, dark fruit, vanilla/oak, cinnamon, moderate bourbon. On the palate, rich dark malts bring caramel, stewed dark fruit, a hint of chocolate. Raisins quite prominent, a decent helping of vanilla and bourbon in the middle with cinnamon. Malt sweetness lingering in the finish and the chilies build up to a pleasant, moderate spice, level, cinnamon and a touch of bourbon. Medium-full body, lightly creamy with no carb. Gorgeous, I really like the integration of cinnamon and chili and the bourbon barrel is held to a supporting role. Way too drinkable for the ABV, interesting and yet has no rough edges.

Bottle. An unclear, brown beer, flat and headless. Rather oily pour. The aroma is spiced and raisiny, making me think of christmas. Some boozy, oaked notes too. Chocolate and coffee. Its full-bodied and warming, with a very soft carbonation level. Chocolate, raisins, bourbon-ish booze and some spices in the flavor. A faint touch of chili towards the finish. Coconut towards the very end, kept company by chocolate and raisins. Some spices too. A bit messy this one, but its still a very nice one. 141220

Bottle 375ml @ fonefan
Pours clear reddish brown with no head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, oak, cinnamon, dried fruits and alcohol. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long warm, caramel, dried fruits, cinnamon and vanilla finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Unclear brown without head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, vanilla, Christmas spices and bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and moderate bitter. Very sweet finish with lots of warming alcohol. 201214

37.5 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden deep brown with no lasting head. Aroma is caramelish and slight spiced, overripe fruity. Toasted malty, spiced, nutmeg and caramelish. Spiced and nutmeg. Dry and herbal finish.

Bottle from Capones and pricey. Some bubbles rather than a head on a dark body. A mild raison aroma. Raison is significant on taste, overpowering the chile in the home stretch. Dangerously drinkable but not for everybody.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Dark brown color, almost black, with a bit of light brown foam. Big aroma of bourbon, vanilla, coconut, dark chocolate, caramel and some nuts. Sweet flavor with malt, chocolate, vanilla, coconut, oak, caramel, dark fruits and a slightly spicy finish with a bit of alcohol. Nice full and rounded mouthfeel. Very good.

On tap at fobab. One of my favorites from the night. Pours a medium brown without much head. Aromas of vanilla, cinnamon, bourbon, slight pepper. Taste was bourbon sweetness with a slightly spicy finish to it. Medium body. Medium low carb.

On tap @ FoBAB 2014. Pour is deep brown with a small white lacing that fades quickly. Aroma and flavor of dark pitted fruit, vanilla bean, cinnamon, slight vegetables, and raisin. Finish is spicy with some bourbon coming through.

Bottle shared by brew3crew - thanks again, Jason! Pours a hazy amber-brown color with no head. Notes of cinnamon, brown sugar, raisin, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, oak, oatmeal, and very light earth, with just the faintest suggestion of chile spice. Comes across somewhere between an oatmeal raisin cookie or a cinnamon roll. Medium-bodied, with low carbonation and a sweet, smooth, lightly spiced mouthfeel. Fun beer.

12.7oz bottle, split with brew3crew and co. Hazy brown, slight red color. Minimal ring of off-white head. The description was making me think oatmeal cookie, and the flavor... Really a lot like oatmeal cookie. Looks like thats what they were going for, based off the description. Whoa, but this is 13.7%??? Damn, well-done. Moderate sweet taste, light bit of tannic, a very light bit of spicy taste, and a very acceptable amount of mild heat in the finish, just a touch of a bite. Bigger body, good full kind of creamy texture, lightly dry, very light slick. Very fun stuff, a treat to try.

Corked bottle, split pour. Pours a darker brown color with a sweet dark fruit and bourbon aroma. A ton of brown sugar, maple, raisin and dark fruits flavor, in that order. From strongest to weakest. Smooth sweet, transitioning flavor all throughout. Well hidden alcohol. Present bourbon, yet super easy to drink. Solid beer here.
Bottle (12.7oz $17). Dark brown with light brown head. Aroma was sweet bourbon. Taste was strong raisin and bourbon. Kind of sticky and somewhat sweet. Slight taste of the chili too.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 October 15, 2016. Bottle. 
Great, lots of toasted coconut, cinnamon, toffee and bourbon.


Original rating:

November 8, 2014. Bottle at VilleValla Pub. 
 Clear dark brown/deep red with a minimal tan head. Aroma is caramel, bourbon, raisins, dark fruits, cinnamon and alcohol notes. Taste is medium sweet bourbon, caramel and raisins. Finish is sweet dried fruits, caramel green pepper with some chili heat and warming alcohol. Smooth oily, medium bodied with average carbonation. 
8-4-8-4-15=39

Raisin bread aged in bourbon barrels. Enough said. Haha. Bottle to glass. Deep brown color with a medium brown head. Aroma is sweet, milky, raisins, dark fruits, bourbon, vanilla. Flavor is a big bourbon, vanilla, dark fruits, molasses. Medium to heavy body with a creamy mouthfeel. Lingering bourbon, vanilla, sweet malts, dark fruits. Fantastic!

WOW!!! Seriously, wow. To start, I love Judgement Day, so putting it in a bourbon barrel to age just makes it better, then adding the cinnamon and chiles to it blows my mind. The raisin is still very evident, some bourbon and oak notes, but the cinnamon melds into it in a way I wasnt expecting. The chiles leaves a bit of a heat sting on the tongue, but nothing too spicy. Love this beer. Deep brown in color with khaki head and lacing. A bit of sweet tobacco is in there too.

Bottle to chalice. Dark ruby pour with a creamy head that grows for a while and then fades into a sizeable ring. Dark fruits and sweetness. Mild cinnamon and chile on the finish. Lots of barrel yum. Smooth mouth.

[ Keg ][ 2oz ][ @FOBAB ][ ][ Tumbler ][ 11.15.14 ]Murky chestnut, red with light beige ring. Coconut and marshmallow oxidation, considerable heat. Sticky flavor, ultra sugar with light cardboard and coconut mid, stale through the papery date end, ultra fizzy carbonation.

Draft at Barrel Republic. Pours rich deep brown with a fizzy beige head. Smells like astringent alcohol, rich raisin, woody, earthy, lots of dark fruit. Tastes like sweet cinnamon sugar, strong booze, and dark fruits.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2015 Bottle into a tulip. Fizzy as soda -- the bubbles pop away after just a few seconds. The liquid below is the darkest purple. Bourbon is easily the most pronounced aromatic, though a swirl does throw off smooth cocoa, vanilla bean, raisin and a dash of sharp cinnamon. Maybe a subtle teriyaki note as well. In the flavor, we get a little more of the dark fruits Judgment Day is known for, along with pronounced whiskey flavor and big, peppery alcohol. The problem is the carbonation level -- its extremely high, fizzing up with every small movement. Really gets in the way of the enjoyment of this beer. 

On draft about seven months later, this is a completely different beer. The aromas like a cinnamon oatmeal raisin cookie, stuffed with savory dark fruits and spice. Raisins and figs are all over the flavor, covering up the huge alcohol content skillfully while strong cinnamon settles in at the finish. Dont know if its the time in the keg or the dialed-in carbonation level, but this is miles better than the bottled version. The scores have been adjusted accordingly.

Bottle shared by AirForceHops, thanks Chris! Pours murky brown with a beige head. Aroma is big on bourbon, some chocolate, raisin, a touch of chili. Flavor is molasses and chocolate and chili and cinnamon. Moderately sweet cinnamon on the finish.

375 thanks to BOLTZ7555, thanks Jason! Deep brown color with low Co2. Aroma is nice subtle bourbon, spiced holiday cake and indeed raisins. Some sugar. Flavor is similar to a liquid raisin cookie the brewer was shooting for. The cinnamon and chili heat comes through right after the end of the sip. The alcohol flavor is here only in the way of warming sensation with the mild spicy kick. Body is fuller and chewy. I really like it... Real nice brew.

Nice pop of the cork on this one. 375ML thanks AirForceHops for sharing and enjoyed in a snifter slightly child. Pours thick with a raisin colored reddish body, not head to speak of but had some carbonation. Nose is very herbal with some holiday cakes and cookies, cinnamon and egg nog and other dark fruits. Very thick and viscous this has a lot of body, nice carbonation mouthfeel. The cinnamon and raisin and whiskey are hugely dominant with a lot of sweet burnt caramelized sugar taste and sweet malts. Cherry, raisin, peach and nutmeg as well. Theres a ton of flavor here. It still burns a little after 2 years in the bottle. Id like a bit less spice but maybe as the weather drops, this is a nice warming beer.

Bottle at RBSDG at the Dad Pad. Pours a dark brown with a thin white head. Coconut on the nose, cocoa and nutty malt. Medium bodied, roast and more coconut, cocoa, chocolate with some faint spicy notes. More nutty coconut, chile and cocoa. Very interesting, warm and toasty. Liked this a bit.

Bottle courtesy of GT2. Pours dark deep brown with a small goldenish beige head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace but some nice looking legs on the glass. Smell is sweet, malty and spicy with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, alcohol, cinnamon, smoked chili, raisins and soil. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter, malty and spicy with sweet dark bread, toffee, caramel, vanilla fudge, charred wood, toasted coconut, cinnamon, smoke chilis, cocoa powder, bourbon alcohol, raisons and soil. Mouthfeel is round, tiny sticky sweet, tiny spicy astringent, boozy and near full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet, tiny bitter, malty and boozy with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, toasted coconut, cinnamon, raisins and soil. Wow! I didnt expect this too be as good and balanced as it it. Quite boozy but it works

Pours dark brown with minimal head. Aroma is sweet cinnamon vanilla barrel some dry peppery tones and booze. Flavor is rich flavorfull of the aromas lots of barrel...wheres the quad? Lost in the flavors maybe?

375mL bottle, courtesy of Prufrockstar (thanks a lot, Chris), pours a dark mahogany with a small beige head. Nose brings out complex notes of bourbon, cinnamon, light chili, and dark fruits. Flavour is extremely complex, with loads of coconut (?!) upfront, somehow, with dark fruits, cinnamon and a very small hint of chili. Its surprising how coconut-y this is. Complex and though there is alcohol, its well-hidden. Excellent.
Pours a dark brown. Aroma of cinnamon chocolate coffee prune. Awesome. Super drinkable

Bottle. Almost clear deep brown liquid with minimal light tan head. Aroma of dried fruit, toffee, bourbon, wood, vanilla, light chili and raw sugar. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of caramel, toffee, dried fruit, coconut and bourbon. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Really good and great barrel character.

Bottle split with the bro. Aroma is chocolate, cinnamon, raisin, and bourbon. Pours dark brown with small white lacing. Taste is like fresh baked cookies. Oatmeal raisin, molasses, cinnamon, chocolate, bourbon and vanilla. Just a smooth sweet drink. Not too sticky. I really loved this one.
Flaske, 375 ml. Mørk rødbrun med et ok beige skum på toppen. Bourbon og træ i næsen. Fyldig, sød, vanilje, træ, krydderihylde, bourbon. Creamy, kompleks, krydret (mere kanel end chili).
11/1/2014. Bottle bought at the brewery. Big boozy, sappy bourbon aromas with hints of licorice. Light spices, and a tiny bit of heat from the peppers. A big beer to sip and enjoy.

Pours deep mahogany into a snifter. Tan head with excellent retention recedes leaving trailing sheets. Dark pit fruit and vanilla aromas. Medium bodied with sweet dark pit fruit and cinnamon upfront turning to mild chile before the hot, lasting vanilla finish.

Bottle thanks to Mike. Pours a flat murky brown to black with reddish highlights. Does LA carbonate their beers anymore? Nose is strong cinnamon, some dark dried fruitiness, as well as a light vegetal note. Taste is immediately oatmeal, raisin, with a light vanilla note. Some subtle spiciness and a light bourbon note. man, some carbonation might jut make this an excellent beer. Alcohol is very well hidden underneath the spiciness and booze. This is really nice.
Sample at GABF 2014. Comes dark brown with a decent tan head. Aroma of bourbon, fruit, and spice. Taste is raisin, fruit, bourbon, spice, and caramel. Complex and interesting. Very good.

dark brown colour, minimal beige head; aroma of whisky, slight vanilla, herbal notes and intensive alcohol; taste of intensive malty sweetness first, raisin, herbs, and some vanilla; alcoholic warmth and hot chilli aftertaste; really great quadrupel, but a bit too much...

08.10.2014, 0,375l bottle sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Small light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is a very strange - in a good way, and a very interesting mix of almost too many things, coconut, mild bourbon, caramel, chocolate, soy sauce, grassy chili, dark sugar, fish sauce, cinnamon, apple pie, alcohol, vanilla. Taste is slightly dry, dark malts, grass, oak, coconut, coffee, cocoa, mild bourbon, cinnamon, mild grassy chili, caramel, dark sugar. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice one!

0.375l corked bottle from Bierkoning, shared with The Tasting Crew. This is a deep and dark brown cloudy looking one whit a small kinda shattered islandy and sidesticking beige head. Smells quite nice. Its definitely spiced up with wood, cinahnom, coconut, wood, green apples, Apple pie crust, sugar and hints of vanilla. Theres definitely lots of things going on here, but I really kinda like it. A mighty and powerful sweet on this one. The cinahnom shines through the sweet boozy caramel sugary flavors. Not super chewy but still rather oily and thick in the mouth, soft to average on the bubbles. Fruity sticky sweet and warming. Its actually leaving a really mild spicy peppery sting all the way back in the throat. Mild but present. Theres lots of different things going on here. The abv is, I guess, kinda well hidden, cause I would never have guessed this as a near 14 percent beer. Interesting and really different. 08.10.2014

Bottle - Lots of boozy bourbon, vanilla and dark roast. Jet brown with a beige head. Toasted coconut, barrel notes, light bourbon and rich malts. Cinnamon and spice are there but more at the end. Much less a bourbon booze than in the nose.

Pours black with a light brown head. Nose of molasses, vanilla, bourbon, caramel and cinnamon. Lovely! Taste is rich with cinnamon, raison, plum, caramel and molasses. Mouthfeel is medium to thick and mouth-coating with chili bite. very complex and impressive brew. Wish I had more.

Bottle @ Lost Abbey. Just about black in color with a khaki head. Really nice combination of bourbon, cinnamon sugar, and vinous, dark fruits. A big time chocolate and vanilla character, too. Caramel, slight booze, and a touch of coconut. Flavor is a bit like french toast at first. Nice spice nose and plenty of sweet caramel. Some bourbon, vanilla, and chocolate. Lots of cherry, raisin, and plum. A bit of oak and sort of boozy.
Shared bottle at Borris House, Co Carlow. No notes, rated from memory. Shared bottle at Borris House, Co Carlow. No notes, rated from memory.

Bottle shared. 500ml corked. Pours dark brown with tan head. Head reduces. Huge rum, raisin, alcohol notes. Flavour is raisin sweet with bourbon and plenty of heat on the way down. Low carbonation with a bang on the finish. Think this is a beer to have on its own. Different.

Extremely bold and aggressive. This one is a combination of a Snicker Doodle, Oatmeal Raisin cookie, fudge, and Hot Tamales! Add a shot of bourbon were in business! Hint of capsaicin, rich vanilla and dough, dark fruit, cocoa dust, and molasses. Thick, coating, and chewy. Nicely done.

Bottle share thanks to beechner224. Sweet, boozy, bourbon, light spiciness and cinnamon character. Dark brown with small tan head. Chocolate, bourbon, light chile notes, boozy, sweet, lots of cinnamon. Very smooth for 13.7%, tasty.
Bottle. Aroma is raisin, dark fruits, strong malt. Taste is sweet, malty, sugary, bourbon, tasty. Goid drinking beer, abv is well hidden.

Bevmo bottle that I really should have checked the price tag on. Dark brown pour with a tan head. Aroma of dark malt, syrup and molasses. The flavor definitely has the raisins but I dont get much spice from the cinnamon or chiles; it might linger a little in the finish. The almost 14 ABV is well hidden.
Poured into a tulip from a bottle. Dark brown pour with tan head. Nose is spice, coconut, cinnamon. Flavor is heavy coconut, spice, booze. A bit too sweet for my tastes but very complex.

Its dark brown with a small tan head. Fairly fizzy. Just some scattered bubbles that fade pretty quickly. The aroma is fairly boozy. Theres caramel, raisin, chocolate, cherry, milder earthy flavors. Cinnamon is still apparent, though restrained, and the chile is pretty weak. Solid bourbon bite. Mild oak. The taste is very much in line with the oatmeal cookie description. though its more of an oatmeal cookie dipped in bourbon. Lots of vanilla, caramel and more fruit than in the nose. Big sweetness. Its bigger on cherries than raisins for me. Some chile heat in the finish. Kinda flabby and boozy but charming in its own way. Slick, full and smooth on the palate. Pretty sticky. Lots of heat. I sorta like it, but I dont want much.

12.7 oz bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Black with just over a finger of bubbly light tan head. Aromas of bourbon, dark fruit, some booze, hint of chiles. Tastes of bourbon, cherries, dark fruit, vanilla, spice. Medium body with a dry finish. Low carbonation. For 13.7% ABV, its pretty damn smooth.
Big frothy head, dark liquid, roasted raisins, cinnamon apparent and bourbon definitely there. Its a good brew and I will buy it again.
Bottle. Pours black brown head. Nose/taste of bourbon, fig, raisin, cinnamon dark fruit and hint of pepper. Full bodied.
